content: May 4 (Reuters) - Russia's largest carmaker Avtovaz said on Thursday that its sales in April rose 225% year-on-year to 27,635 vehicles.

Traditionally reliant on Western parts and investment, Russia's car industry has been one of the hardest hit by Western sanctions and the fallout of Moscow's military campaign in Ukraine.Overall Russian car sales collapsed by 58.8% in 2022, according to the Association of European Businesses. Avtovaz's sales dropped 46% last year.Compared to March 2023, sales in April rose 18.4%, Avtovaz said. (Reporting by Reuters; Editing by Jacqueline Wong)
